questions.question: What is one way data scientists can deliver new insights to end users?
What is an example of 'a new viewport on your data'?
options: Customer segmentation fed back to the database as a new dimension
questions.answer: Customer segmentation fed back to the database as a new dimension

questions.question: Why might delivering a prototype dashboard be beneficial even in large organizations with reporting teams?
options: It presents an example and can shorten delivery time.
It replaces the need for the reporting team.
It is required by company policy.
questions.answer: It presents an example and can shorten delivery time.

questions.question: What kind of decisions often require only a one-time analysis and report?
What is the ultimate purpose of a business report?
options: To increase the number of meetings

questions.question: What is a report?
options: Any communication artifact prepared to convey specific information
questions.answer: Any communication artifact prepared to convey specific information

questions.question: Which of these is a key characteristic of a successful report?
options: Using as many technical terms as possible

questions.question: What is data visualization defined as?
options: The use of databases to store numbers
The use of visual representations to explore, make sense of, and communicate data
The process of cleaning raw data
The act of writing a report
questions.answer: The use of visual representations to explore, make sense of, and communicate data

questions.question: How is information different from data in the context of visualization?
options: Information is raw numbers, data is processed.
Information is the aggregation, summarization, and contextualization of data.
They are exactly the same thing.
Data is visual, information is textual.
questions.answer: Information is the aggregation, summarization, and contextualization of data.

questions.question: Which of these is a 'Basic Chart or Graph'?
Which of these is a 'Specialized Chart or Graph'?
What does a PERT Chart stand for?
Which chart is specifically designed to show progress towards a goal in the context of other measures?
What type of chart is best for showing the relationship between two variables?
What is a Geographic Map used for in data visualization?
options: To display data related to specific locations
To compare parts of a whole
questions.answer: To display data related to specific locations

questions.question: A Heat Map or Tree Map is useful for showing what?
options: The magnitude of values across two categories using color
The exact numerical value of every data point
questions.answer: The magnitude of values across two categories using color

questions.question: Which chart type uses slices to represent proportions of a whole?
What might a real-time dashboard help prevent?
options: Other people misinterpreting newly discovered information in reports
questions.answer: Other people misinterpreting newly discovered information in reports

questions.question: What is the source of data for a business report?
options: Only data from inside the organization
Data from inside and outside the organization (via ETL)
questions.answer: Data from inside and outside the organization (via ETL)

questions.question: What is NOT listed as a function of a report?
In a smaller organization, who is often in charge of the entire data cycle from gathering to reporting?
What is a Highlight Table?
options: A table with emphasized (e.g., colored) cells to draw attention
The title page of a report
questions.answer: A table with emphasized (e.g., colored) cells to draw attention

questions.question: What is a Gantt Chart typically used for?
options: Project scheduling and tracking tasks over time
questions.answer: Project scheduling and tracking tasks over time

questions.question: Which chart adds a third dimension of data through the size of its points?
What is the sequence of the management process supported by reporting?
options: Data acquisition -> Information generation -> Decision making -> Process management
Decision making -> Data acquisition -> Process management -> Information generation
Process management -> Decision making -> Information generation -> Data acquisition
Information generation -> Process management -> Data acquisition -> Decision making
questions.answer: Data acquisition -> Information generation -> Decision making -> Process management

questions.question: What does the 'Correctness' of a report refer to?
options: The accuracy of its information and calculations
questions.answer: The accuracy of its information and calculations

questions.question: Operational decisions typically require reports to be what?
options: Done only once by an external consultant

questions.question: What is a formal report's typical length?
Information visualization is related to which of the following?
options: Information graphics, scientific visualization, and statistical graphics
questions.answer: Information graphics, scientific visualization, and statistical graphics
